TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EventAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies additional event schema information for an event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you apply this attribute to an ETW event method defined on an <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource>-derived class, you must call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.WriteEvent%2A> method on the base class, passing the event ID, followed by the same arguments as the defined method is passed. You should follow the pattern shown in the following examples.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the EventAttribute class to define a variety of events. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_1.cs)]
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_2.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_2.cs)]
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_3.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_3.cs)]
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_4.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_2_4.cs)]

Docs.param: The event identifier for the event.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event identifier.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the EventAttribute constructor to specify events. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.diagnostics.tra_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.diagnostics.tra_1_1.cs)]
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.diagnostics.tra_1_2.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.diagnostics.tra_1_2.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the event.
Docs.value: The event identifier. This value should be between 0 and 65535.

remarks.format: ## Remarks EventId should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in a tracing operation. If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the keywords for the event.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the enumeration values.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Keywords property to define event keywords. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the level for the event.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level for the event.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Level property to specify event levels. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.diagnostics.tra_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.diagnostics.tra_3_1.cs)]

[!code-vb[ETWTrace#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.diagnostics.tra_3_3.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.diagnostics.tra_3_3.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the message for the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use standard .NET Framework substitution operators (for example, {1}) in the string). They will be replaced with the string representation of the corresponding part of the event payload.
``` [Event(1, Message = "Application Falure: {0}", Level = EventLevel.Error, Keywords = Keywords.Diagnostic)] public void Failure(string message) { WriteEvent(1, message); }
```
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Message property to specify event messages. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.diagnostics.tra_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.diagnostics.tra_0_1.cs)]
